title: Young Girl Holding a Basket

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pastel on pink laid paper with red fibrous inclusions (pieced at bottom), stretched and edge mounted on a honeycomb paper panel.

description: This large-scale drawing is a study for the painting The Cherry Tree (1891, Musée Marmottan Monet, Paris). The model is Berthe Morisot’s niece, Jeanne Gobillard, who lifts a basket to gather fruit. The light passages of yellow pastel suggest patches of sunlight reflecting off her hat, hair, and dress. The pink paper Morisot used adds additional luminosity to this outdoor scene.
medium_display: Pastel on pink laid paper with red fibrous inclusions (pieced at bottom), stretched and edge mounted on a honeycomb paper panel
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history:
M.-L. Bataille and G. Wildenstein, Berthe Morisot: Catalogue des peintures, pastel et aquarelles (Paris: Beaux-Arts, 1961), p. 59, no. 571, fig. 563.

Charles F. Stuckey and William P. Scott, Berthe Morisot: Impressionist (Hudson-Hills, 1987), p. 152.

Suzanne Folds McCullagh (ed.), Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 2006), p. 127, cat. 88 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Paris, Durand-Ruel, "Berthe Morisot," Mar. 1896, cat. 180.

Paris, Galerie Dru, "Portraits et Figures de Femme," 1928, cat. 4.

Art Institute of Chicago, "Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," June 3–July 30, 2006, p. 127, cat. 88 (ill.).
provenance_text: Estate of the artist [stamp (Lugt 1826) recto, lower right, in black]; J. M. Rouart, Paris; sold, Galerie Charpentier, Paris, Feb. 23, 1954, lot 46. Sold, Sotheby’s, London, Mar. 27, 1985, lot 317, to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, Brookline, MA.; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2013.
